main event: Multiple unidentified objects were observed by both ground visual and radar near Charleston, South Carolina on January 16, 1967.
interesting points: The objects were described as round, silver and blue in color with a red ring, and some had a beam of light coming from the tail end.
The objects were tracked on radar at high speeds up to 720 knots and altitudes up to 30,000 feet.
One object was initially stationary at 6,000 feet, but then joined another object that had approached from the south, and both climbed to 30,000 feet before vanishing.
Weather conditions were clear and cold, with temperature inversions and moisture inversions noted at high altitudes.
The Air Force investigator, Lt. Paul Jones, recommended that this case be logged as a definite UFO sighting.
sighted object: multiple round, silver and blue objects with red rings and some with beams of light
witnesses: ground visual observers and radar operators
